update.description: To enable graphical inertia modification in gazebo (see [design document](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/b2d3fd8746867/inertia_resize/inertia_resize.md) and [design document pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/pull-requests/28/move-physics-inertial-to-ignition-math-add/diff)) the [gazebo::physics::Inertial](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/f69b82f6e25ce51bac/gazebo/physics/Inertial.hh) is being ported to ignition math. The first step in that process is creating a new sub-class called `MassMatrix3` that contains the scalar mass and the symmetric moment of inertia matrix components. A follow-up pull request will provide functionality for diagonalizing an inertia matrix to identify the principal moments of inertia and orientation of the principal axes. For now, the new class is added with accessors,modifiers and basic operators.
update.title: First part of MassMatrix3 class, mostly accessors and modifiers

content.raw: Yes, Ian and I have seen similar issues with coverage of destructors. To help coverage, add a test where the destructor called from a "delete" as well as the stack. I found that for my test, I had to create an instance with new and call delete on it, otherwise it would not get covered. If that doesn't fix it, you can try to declare the destructor explicitely if you are relying on the compiler's one.
content.html: Yes, Ian and I have seen similar issues with coverage of destructors. To help coverage, add a test where the destructor called from a "delete" as well as the stack. I found that for my test, I had to create an instance with new and call delete on it, otherwise it would not get covered. If that doesn't fix it, you can try to declare the destructor explicitely if you are relying on the compiler's one.

content.raw:
I just ran lcov on my machine, and found my way to the `MassMatrix3.hh` description, then noticed a link at the top for functions (at `build/coverage/math/MassMatrix3.hh.func.html`). This shows the mangled function names. ![MassMatrix3d_function_coverage.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/dg5enz/images/3355472338-MassMatrix3d_function_coverage.png)

I demangled two of these, which are both destructors, but is marked as called, while the other is uncalled:

~~~
$ c++filt
_ZN8ignition4math11MassMatrix3IdED0Ev
ignition::math::MassMatrix3<double>::~MassMatrix3()
_ZN8ignition4math11MassMatrix3IdED2Ev
ignition::math::MassMatrix3<double>::~MassMatrix3()
~~~

I'm confused but am assuming it is a quirk of lcov.
content.html:
I just ran lcov on my machine, and found my way to the MassMatrix3.hh description, then noticed a link at the top for functions (at build/coverage/math/MassMatrix3.hh.func.html). This shows the mangled function names.

I demangled two of these, which are both destructors, but is marked as called, while the other is uncalled:

$ c++filt
_ZN8ignition4math11MassMatrix3IdED0Ev
ignition::math::MassMatrix3<double>::~MassMatrix3()
_ZN8ignition4math11MassMatrix3IdED2Ev
ignition::math::MassMatrix3<double>::~MassMatrix3()

I'm confused but am assuming it is a quirk of lcov.

The first step in that process is creating a new sub-class called `MassMatrix3` that contains the scalar mass and the symmetric moment of inertia matrix components. A follow-up pull request will provide functionality for diagonalizing an inertia matrix to identify the principal moments of inertia and orientation of the principal axes. For now, the new class is added with accessors,modifiers and basic operators.

pullrequest.title: First part of MassMatrix3 class, mostly accessors and modifiers

content.raw:
There's two aspects to a "valid" `MassMatrix3`:

* positive mass and positive definite moment of inertia matrix (test with `IsPositive`, most expensive operation is a 3x3 matrix construction and determinant)
* Principal moments must satisfy the triangle inequality (test with `IsValid`). If the inertia matrix is not diagonalized, then it must be diagonalized (function to come in a future pull request), which is a more complex operation.
content.html:
There's two aspects to a "valid" MassMatrix3:

  • positive mass and positive definite moment of inertia matrix (test with IsPositive, most expensive operation is a 3x3 matrix construction and determinant)
  • Principal moments must satisfy the triangle inequality (test with IsValid). If the inertia matrix is not diagonalized, then it must be diagonalized (function to come in a future pull request), which is a more complex operation.

content.raw:
I wonder if we will run into problems due to unrealistic default values, as we did for the simple shapes before. Even though this is different from the simple shapes because it should be more generic...

An idea that just crossed my mind is to start as an "invalid" mass matrix that becomes valid after the user manually specifies all values. I'm thinking of how it works for [QColor](http://doc.qt.io/qt-4.8/qcolor.html#QColor). The color starts invalid if you use the default constructor.
content.html:
I wonder if we will run into problems due to unrealistic default values, as we did for the simple shapes before. Even though this is different from the simple shapes because it should be more generic...

An idea that just crossed my mind is to start as an "invalid" mass matrix that becomes valid after the user manually specifies all values. I'm thinking of how it works for QColor. The color starts invalid if you use the default constructor.
